Key Match Events: The first matchup of Japanese-born starting pitchers in Major League postseason history will take place between Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Yu Darvish in Game 5 of the National League Division Series.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said Yoshinobu Yamamoto 'will be a part of it' for Game 5, but didn't name him as the starter until later.
Padres manager Mike Shildt compared his team's approach to that of Vince Lombardi, emphasizing their determination to win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers will have six or seven relievers available for Game 5, including Jack Flaherty.
Injured shortstop Miguel Rojas won't be in the Dodgers' starting lineup, but will be available to pinch hit.
Freddie Freeman is expected to return to the lineup after missing Game 4 with a sprained right ankle.
Others: Yoshinobu Yamamoto is the highest paid pitcher in the majors, with a $325 million, 12-year deal.
The Dodgers used eight relievers to shut out the Padres in Game 4, setting up the dramatic finale between the heated rivals.
